title: Second child dies after Paoli shooting
content:
Feb. 12 update: Second child dies after Paoli shooting
A 6-year-old southern Indiana boy has died two days after a shooting that also killed his younger sister, state police say.
Sgt. Phillip Hensley said Leon Gehl died at Kosair Children's Hospital in Louisville, Kentucky, on Thursday.
Police said Leon and his 3-year-old sister, Addison, were shot by their father, 37-year-old Jeremy Gehl, during a domestic disturbance at their Paoli home on Tuesday. Police reports show Jeremy Gehl attacked estranged wife Melissa Randolph with a knife during an altercation and shot the children when they entered the room. He then took his own life.
Randolph's wounds weren't life-threatening. A third child in the home wasn't harmed.
The Times-Mail in Bedford reported Thursday that Gehl was living with the family in violation of a protective order that was filed in 2013. It was set to expire next week.
The protective order, filed in Orange Superior Court, prohibited Gehl from having direct or indirect contact with Randolph except as it related to their children. It also ordered Gehl to stay away from Randolph's residence and place of employment
Feb. 11, 2015, story:
Paoli dad kills daughter, 3, self; wounds others
PAOLI, Ind. — State Police have released the names of two southern Indiana children they say were shot by their father, one of them fatally, after he stabbed his estranged wife.
Police say 3-year-old Addison Gehl and her 6-year-old brother, Leon Gehl, were shot inside their home in Paoli Tuesday evening.
Addison Gehl was pronounced dead at a Louisville, Kentucky, hospital, where her brother was listed Wednesday in critical condition.
Sgt. Phillip Hensley says 37-year-old Jeremy Gehl stabbed his 33-year-old wife, Melissa Randolph, inflicting non-life-threatening injuries.
Hensley says Gehl shot the two children when they came downstairs after hearing their parents fighting. Gehl then took his own life.
Hensley says the couple was estranged but still living in the same house.
A toddler in the home was unharmed during the attacks.
